Trial_Design.evidence: 622 women with clinical stage 2–3 estrogen receptor-positive (ER+) BC were enrolled

Participants.evidence: 622 women with clinical stage 2–3 estrogen receptor-positive (ER+) BC were enrolled

Intervention.evidence: ability of three neoadjuvant aromatase inhibitors (NAIs) to reduce residual disease

Objective.evidence: to assess whether switching to neoadjuvant chemotherapy (NCT) after 4 weeks on NAI with Ki67 > 10% increases pathologic complete response (pCR)

Method_Outcome.evidence: Five-year cumulative incidence rate for LRR is estimated to be 1.53% (95% CI: 0.7 to 3.0%)

Number_Randomised.evidence: 622 women with clinical stage 2–3 estrogen receptor-positive (ER+) BC were enrolled

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis cohort consisted of 509 patients

Result_Outcome.evidence: Five-year cumulative incidence rate for LRR is estimated to be 1.53% (95% CI: 0.7 to 3.0%)
